user_persona: A local researcher exploring neighborhood data.
user_goal: To navigate and select a region on the interactive map.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing the Map Interface
narrative_steps.description: Maria opens the app and sees the full-screen interactive map centered on her city. She notices the ivory background and forest green controls.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map loads centered on a default region with correct styling applied.

narrative_steps.title: Zooming In
narrative_steps.description: Maria scrolls over the map to get a closer look at a specific neighborhood.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map zooms in smoothly while keeping the cursor position centered.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting a Region
narrative_steps.description: She clicks on a particular neighborhood to select it for further analysis.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The region's boundary is highlighted in forest green, and it appears in the side panel.

requirement_tested: Allow users to select and compare multiple geographic areas
user_persona: A policy analyst comparing urban development outcomes.
user_goal: To select multiple neighborhoods and initiate a comparison.

narrative_steps.title: Adding Areas to Compare
narrative_steps.description: David selects three different neighborhoods from the map, which appear in the right sidebar.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each selected area appears in the comparison list in the sidebar with a remove button.

narrative_steps.title: Removing One Area
narrative_steps.description: He realizes one area isn't relevant and removes it from the list.
narrative_steps.action: Click the remove icon next to an area.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The deselected area disappears from the comparison list.

narrative_steps.title: Starting Comparison
narrative_steps.description: Satisfied with his selections, he clicks the 'Compare Areas' button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard switches to show visualizations comparing the remaining selected areas.

user_persona: A social worker assessing community needs.
user_goal: To review demographic trends across selected neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Demographic Charts
narrative_steps.description: Sarah navigates to the demographic section and sees bar charts showing age distribution and income levels.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the demographic visualization section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Collapsible bar charts render with forest green axes and labels on an ivory background.

narrative_steps.title: Toggling Data Series
narrative_steps.description: She toggles off the 'Education Level' series to focus on income data.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the legend item for 'Education Level'.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The corresponding data series disappears from the chart.

narrative_steps.title: Inspecting Data Points
narrative_steps.description: She hovers over a bar to see exact figures for median household income.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a data point in the chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tooltip appears showing the exact value and time period.

user_persona: An economist analyzing regional growth patterns.
user_goal: To analyze employment and housing trends over time.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Line Graphs
narrative_steps.description: James views line graphs displaying employment rates and housing prices over several years.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the economic visualization section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Line graphs with titled axes render properly in forest green on ivory background.

narrative_steps.title: Isolating a Category
narrative_steps.description: He clicks on the employment rate line to isolate it for clearer viewing.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a line segment in the graph.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Only the selected data category is displayed prominently.

narrative_steps.title: Examining Specific Values
narrative_steps.description: James hovers over a peak in the housing price trend to see the exact value.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a node in the line graph.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A floating label shows the precise value and date.

user_persona: A public safety officer evaluating neighborhood risk.
user_goal: To compare crime statistics between selected areas.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Stacked Charts
narrative_steps.description: Lisa examines stacked column charts showing total crimes, violent crimes, and property crimes.
narrative_steps.action: Navigate to the crime visualization section.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Stacked column charts are rendered with proper forest green and ivory theming.

narrative_steps.title: Drilling Down Into Crime Types
narrative_steps.description: She clicks on a segment representing violent crimes to isolate that category.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The chart updates to highlight only the selected crime type.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Detailed Breakdown
narrative_steps.description: She hovers over a segment to see exact counts and percentages.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over a segment in the chart.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tooltip displays detailed counts and percentage breakdowns.

requirement_tested: Provide data dashboard with interactive charts
user_persona: A city planner monitoring urban metrics.
user_goal: To organize and interact with various data visualizations.

narrative_steps.title: Observing Dashboard Layout
narrative_steps.description: Robert sees a grid of draggable and resizable chart panels upon entering the dashboard.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Dashboard renders with a grid layout of chart panels styled correctly.

narrative_steps.title: Moving a Panel
narrative_steps.description: He drags a demographic chart to a new position to group similar metrics together.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The panel repositions smoothly within the grid without overlapping.

narrative_steps.title: Resizing a Chart
narrative_steps.description: He resizes a crime chart to give it more space for better readability.
narrative_steps.action: Resize the edges of a panel.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The panel adjusts its dimensions without disrupting adjacent panels.

user_persona: A data analyst personalizing his workspace.
user_goal: To save and later recall a preferred dashboard layout.

narrative_steps.title: Saving Current Layout
narrative_steps.description: After rearranging his dashboard, Alex clicks the save layout icon.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A prompt asks him to confirm and name the layout.

narrative_steps.title: Naming and Confirming Save
narrative_steps.description: He names the layout 'Q2 Analysis' and confirms saving.
narrative_steps.action: Enter a name and confirm save.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout is saved and appears in the saved layouts dropdown.

narrative_steps.title: Loading Saved Layout
narrative_steps.description: Later, he selects 'Q2 Analysis' from the dropdown to restore his setup.
narrative_steps.action: Select a saved layout from the dropdown.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The dashboard instantly reconfigures to match the saved layout.

requirement_tested: Support area selection through map clicking or search
user_persona: A real estate agent scouting new markets.
user_goal: To quickly locate and select specific neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Searching for Location
narrative_steps.description: Patricia types 'Downtown' into the search bar and sees suggestions.
narrative_steps.action: Type into the search input field.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Auto-suggestions appear below the search bar matching the input.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Search Result
narrative_steps.description: She clicks on 'Downtown District' from the suggestions.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The map pans and zooms to the selected area.

narrative_steps.title: Adding Area via Click
narrative_steps.description: With click-to-select enabled, she clicks on another nearby region.
narrative_steps.action: Click on a region with click-to-select mode enabled.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The newly clicked region is added to the comparison list.

user_goal: To compare demographic characteristics of different areas.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Comparison Table
narrative_steps.description: Nina navigates to the demographic comparison view and sees a table with selected areas.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A tabular view appears with areas listed vertically and metrics horizontally.

narrative_steps.title: Sorting by Income
narrative_steps.description: She clicks the 'Median Income' column header to sort areas.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Rows reorder based on descending median income values.

narrative_steps.title: Tracking Rows Visually
narrative_steps.description: As she scans the table, she hovers over rows for better readability.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The hovered row is highlighted to help track data across columns.

user_persona: A financial advisor evaluating investment zones.
user_goal: To compare economic health indicators between regions.

narrative_steps.title: Accessing Economic Comparison
narrative_steps.description: Mark selects the economic comparison tab and sees key metrics like employment rate and housing prices.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A structured table with economic KPIs is displayed.

narrative_steps.title: Ranking by Employment Rate
narrative_steps.description: He sorts the table by 'Employment Rate' to identify top-performing areas.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Employment Rate' column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Areas are reordered based on employment rate values.

narrative_steps.title: Reviewing Sorted Data
narrative_steps.description: Mark hovers over rows to keep track of data as he reviews.
narrative_steps.action: Hover over rows in the table.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Each row highlights on hover for improved readability.

user_persona: A community organizer promoting safety awareness.
user_goal: To compare crime levels among selected neighborhoods.

narrative_steps.title: Viewing Crime Statistics Table
narrative_steps.description: Emily opens the crime comparison table and sees metrics like total incidents and violent crime ratios.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A table with crime-specific metrics is displayed correctly.

narrative_steps.title: Ranking Areas by Safety
narrative_steps.description: She sorts the table by 'Violent Crime Ratio' to identify safer areas.
narrative_steps.action: Click on the 'Violent Crime Ratio' column header.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Areas are sorted from lowest to highest violent crime ratio.

narrative_steps.title: Analyzing Results
narrative_steps.description: Emily hovers over rows to easily scan data across different metrics.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Row highlighting provides visual continuity during analysis.

requirement_tested: Allow users to filter data by time periods
user_persona: A journalist writing about neighborhood trends.
user_goal: To focus data visualizations on a specific time range.

narrative_steps.title: Opening Time Filter Dropdown
narrative_steps.description: Carlos clicks the 'Time Period' dropdown to adjust data scope.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A list of predefined time ranges appears.

narrative_steps.title: Selecting Custom Date Range
narrative_steps.description: He chooses 'Custom Range' and picks dates covering the last six months.
narrative_steps.action: Select 'Custom Range' and pick start/end dates.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Calendar pickers open to define the custom date range.

narrative_steps.title: Applying Time Filter
narrative_steps.description: After selecting dates, he applies the filter to update all visualizations.
narrative_steps.action: Confirm and apply the selected date range.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All active charts reload with data filtered to the chosen time period.

requirement_tested: Provide export functionality for comparison reports
user_persona: A government official preparing a presentation.
user_goal: To download a formatted report of his analysis.

narrative_steps.title: Initiating Export
narrative_steps.description: Rey notices the export icon and clicks it to generate a report.
narrative_steps.action: Click the export floating action button.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A modal opens prompting him to choose a file format.

narrative_steps.title: Choosing Export Format
narrative_steps.description: He selects PDF for easy sharing in presentations.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The system prepares the report in PDF format.

narrative_steps.title: Downloading Report
narrative_steps.description: The report generates and downloads automatically.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: A downloadable PDF file is generated and saved to his device.

requirement_tested: Implement responsive design for different screen sizes
user_persona: A student researching neighborhoods on a tablet.
user_goal: To access the application seamlessly on a smaller screen.

narrative_steps.title: Loading App on Tablet
narrative_steps.description: Jenny opens the app on her tablet and observes how the layout adapts.
narrative_steps.action: Load the application on a tablet-sized screen.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Content stacks vertically and font sizes adjust for readability.

narrative_steps.title: Interacting With Responsive Controls
narrative_steps.description: She taps on a map region to select it, noting touch-friendly controls.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The region is selected and appears in the adjusted sidebar layout.

narrative_steps.title: Testing Layout Changes
narrative_steps.description: She rotates her tablet to landscape mode to see how the layout responds.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The layout reflows to accommodate the new orientation effectively.

requirement_tested: Use ivory background color and forest green component styling
user_persona: A UX reviewer auditing visual consistency.
user_goal: To verify the application follows the specified color scheme.

narrative_steps.title: Checking Background Color
narrative_steps.description: Tom inspects the overall page background to ensure it uses ivory.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: The background color is consistently ivory (#FFFFF0) throughout.

narrative_steps.title: Verifying Component Styling
narrative_steps.description: He checks that interactive elements like buttons and charts use forest green.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: All relevant elements use forest green (#228B22) as the accent color.

narrative_steps.title: Validating Contrast
narrative_steps.description: Tom ensures text and borders have sufficient contrast against the background.
narrative_steps.expected_outcome: Contrast levels meet accessibility standards for readability.
